news.title: Ireland to be hit by Storm Floris as Met Éireann issues August Bank Holiday weather advisory
news.summary: Ireland will be hit by Storm Floris over the Bank Holiday weekend, Met Éireann has warned as it issued a weather advisory.

news.title: Conor McGregor says he won’t pay friend James Lawrence’s legal costs over Nikita Hand case after appeal fails
news.summary: Conor McGregor has insisted he will not be paying the legal costs of James Lawrence, in a lengthy post on social media.

news.title: Rúaidhrí O’Connor’s preview: It’s hard to see Australia stopping the clean sweep with the Lions licking their lips
news.summary: Australia is not the most difficult place to tour and these are not vintage Wallabies, but if the Lions can complete their tour unbeaten and sweep Joe Schmidt’s sides in the Test series then their place in history is secured.

news.title: Donald Trump orders US navy to move nuclear submarines towards Russia
news.summary: Donald Trump has moved two nuclear submarines towards Russia in an escalating war of words with its former president.

news.title: 'I never questioned it and afterwards, I felt so stupid': discovering that your partner has been cheating on you
news.summary: Andy Byron and Kristin Cabot were made instant, albeit undoubtedly unwilling, internet stars when they were captured in a cosy embrace while watching the concert.

news.title: ‘What a f***ing b***h’ – Call centre worker who thought she was on hold loses unfair dismissal claim
news.summary: A telephonist who was “marched out” of a call centre after being sacked for using “abusive and foul language” over an open phone line in the mistaken belief she had put the customer on hold has lost a claim for unfair dismissal and disability discrimination.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s reviews on the road: The best of the best spots to eat in the West – from Connemara to Galway city
news.summary: August is the month when city folk take to the hills or seashores. New Yorkers head to the Hamptons, Spaniards to the Balearics. Parisians to the Cote d’Azur, Corkonians to Baltimore. Dubs to the waters and wilds of various corners of this small island.

news.title: From ‘Showgirls’ to ‘In the Cut’, 10 movies that derailed their stars’ careers
news.summary: Most movie stars can ­survive a flop or two. But then there are roles that completely upend an actor’s career, leaving them out of work or for ever changed in the eye of the public.

news.title: Ultimate August bank holiday event guide: Planes, parades, Pride, President Higgins and more
news.summary: This August bank holiday may not be a scorcher but it will still pack a punch in terms of the jam-packed programme of activities taking place across the country in the coming days.

news.title: Meet the Gen Z-ers making golf cool: ‘Younger people are coming in and things are going to change’
news.summary: When Shauna McIntyre was in her teens, she’d spend weekends on the golf course in Rathfarnham, Dublin, either with her parents or her one other friend who enjoyed the sport, Stephanie Glennon.
